content.overview: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the fundamental building block of web development. It is used to create the structure and content of a webpage. From text and images to links and multimedia, everything you see on a website starts with HTML.
learningObjectives: Understand what HTML is and why it is essential.
Identify the basic structure of an HTML document.
Use fundamental HTML tags to create a webpage.
Differentiate between tags, elements, and attributes.

keyConcepts.WhatIsHtml?: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. It is not a programming language but a markup language used to structure content on the web.
keyConcepts.Importance: HTML is the backbone of the web, providing the foundation for all web content.

BasicStructure.description: A basic HTML document follows this structure:
BasicStructure.example:
Welcome to HTML

This is a paragraph of text.

CommonTags.description: Define headings of different levels, from <h1> (largest) to <h6> (smallest).
Create hyperlinks to other pages or websites.

Open the file in a web browser to view your webpage.

content.overview: This lesson delves into advanced HTML concepts, covering semantic elements, forms, multimedia, and accessibility. These skills are essential for creating professional, user-friendly, and accessible web pages.
learningObjectives: Understand the purpose and usage of semantic HTML elements.
Create and style advanced HTML forms.
Embed and control multimedia content in web pages.
Implement accessibility best practices using ARIA attributes.

SemanticHTML.description: Semantic HTML elements clearly describe their meaning in a way that is both human- and machine-readable.
SemanticHTML.example:
Website Title

  • Home
  • About

Article Title

This is an article.

© 2025 My Website

Forms.description: Forms collect user input and send it to a server for processing.
Forms.example:
<form action="/submit" method="POST">
  <label for="username">Username:</label>
  <input type="text" id="username" name="username" required>

  <label for="email">Email:</label>
  <input type="email" id="email" name="email" required>

  <label for="password">Password:</label>
  <input type="password" id="password" name="password" required>

  <button type="submit">Submit</button>
</form>

Multimedia.description: HTML allows embedding multimedia elements such as audio and video.
Multimedia.example:
<video controls>
  <source src="video.mp4" type="video/mp4">
  Your browser does not support the video tag.
</video>

<audio controls>
  <source src="audio.mp3" type="audio/mpeg">
  Your browser does not support the audio element.
</audio>

steps: Design a form with text, email, and password inputs.
activity.code:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
  <title>Form Example</title>
</head>
<body>
  <form action="/submit" method="POST">
    <label for="name">Name:</label>
    <input type="text" id="name" name="name">

    <label for="email">Email:</label>
    <input type="email" id="email" name="email">

    <button type="submit">Submit</button>
  </form>
</body>
</html>

learningObjectives: Understand what JavaScript is and why it is important.
Learn basic syntax and how to include JavaScript in a webpage.
